page.title: 06The Churchyard in Sulgrave
page.content: The churchyard surrounds the church on all sides and is entered by an evergreen tree lined path on the north side and a lych-gate on the south.The grass is cut regularly and relatives of the dead visit the graves bringing flowers with them. A recent survey recorded 318 gravestones many of them without a name or date due to weathering.Many stones have been used to rebuild the perimeter wall.Graves sometimes had head and foot stones with details of the dead person recorded on them.Others were chest tombs,slabs,crosses or just left as mounds.The materials used were local Hornton stone,Granite,Sandstone,Forest of Dean stone,Black and White marble.It is now only possible to use Black marble with special permission from the Bishop of Peterborough because of its unnatural appearance.
